document.full_text: the owners of a california web site that sold beatles songs for 25 cents each before they went on sale legally through itunes have agreed to pay the band's emi group label $950,000 to settle a copyright infringement lawsuit, court papers showed on monday.
document.title: website to pay $950,000 for beatles piracy
lines_and_colors: the owners of a california web site that sold beatles songs for 25 cents each before they went on sale legally through itunes have agreed to pay the band's emi group label $950,000 to settle a copyright infringement lawsuit, court papers showed on monday.
